profile.name: Matteo Golin
profile.description:
I'm a computer systems engineering student with a passion for automation, design and abstraction within computing technologies.
I'm looking for a position that can provide me with experience in the technology field and challenge me to grow my skill-set.

sars: Awarded the Henry M Tory scholarship for an admission average of 93%, which was renewed during the second year for maintaining an 11.80 CGPA.
Admitted to the Golden Key International Honour Society for placing within the top 15% of students in computer systems engineering.
Designed and launched an ecommerce website for the publication which provided additional income.
Developed and presented an SEO optimization workshop to staff, resulting in higher search engine rankings for articles.
Articulated troubleshooting instructions to staff who encountered difficulties publishing to the website which sped up workflow.

Programmed automation tools using Selenium and the WordPress REST API in Python to post polls to the website and design and send the publication newsletter every week, resulting in more efficient time usage.
Assessed ingredient preparation times and staff capabilities in order to divide up tasks, resulting in faster meal completion during service.
Assisted serving staff with their tasks following completion of kitchen responsibilities, allowing for faster closing times.
Participated in several on-site lab experiments and expert lectures about the marine ecology of New Brunswick.

projects.title: Library Database
sars: Implemented a unit testing system in Python for group member code which caught errors before integration with the main codebase, resulting in a faster debugging process.
Compared task difficulty with team member skill sets and availability in order to assign tasks as the team lead, resulting in completion of deliverables before due dates.
Documented the project codebase with type annotations, docstrings, usage instructions, dependencies, algorithm explanations and a project report, resulting in ease of use and maintainability.

projects.title: Logic Gates
sars: Drew logic gate schematic assets based off of schematics seen in class to allow for visualization of generated schematics.
Designed Python algorithms to create randomized schematics, calculate Karnaugh maps and stitch together assets into exportable PNG files of schematics.
Analyzed code for slow functionality, and researched optimizations to overcome memory and processing limitations in calculating Karnaugh maps, resulting in faster generation.
Documented code and created a command-line interface, allowing for ease of use and a maintainable code base.

projects.title: Conway
sars: Examined previously built Conway's Game of Life applications and their different rule sets in order to implement variety to the project.
Engineered a class-based approach to the simulation in Python, including different cell types, modifiable starting seeds, an iterable game scene and a GIF exporter.
Documented code with type definitions, docstrings and a README file for maintainability.
